summary: This document is a series of FBI emails from April 2023 discussing a deconfliction request from FinCEN regarding the release of Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reveal FBI objections to releasing information due to Ghislaine Maxwell's pending appeal, and include a list of names and entities for review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her pending appeal is cited as the reason the USAO and FBI object to releasing information related to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The civil lawsuits against banks are based on their provision of financial services to him.

persons.name: Robert Trivers
persons.context: Listed among 10 additional names provided by FinCEN for the FBI to review and potentially object to the release of information about.

persons.name: Amanda
persons.context: Addressed in an email confirming the lack of objection to releasing information, including mentions of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Carmen
persons.context: Addressed in an email relaying the FBI's formal objection to releasing information due to Maxwell's appeal.

connections.description: Maxwell's conviction and pending appeal are directly tied to the Epstein case, leading to legal restrictions on information release.
Trivers's name appears on a list for deconfliction related to the Epstein financial investigation, suggesting a documented connection.

events.title: FBI Objects to SARs Release
events.description: The FBI, after consulting the NY CDC office, formally objects to FinCEN releasing information related to an ongoing matter, specifically Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal.

events.title: Civil Lawsuits Against Banks
events.description: Ongoing civil lawsuits in SDNY against JP Morgan Chase and Deutsche Bank for providing financial services to Jeffrey Epstein. The US Virgin Islands is also separately suing JP Morgan.

events.title: FinCEN Deconfliction Deadline
events.description: FinCEN issues an urgent request for the FBI to deconflict on releasing SARs related to Epstein, with an initial deadline of COB 3/29/2023.

locations: Federal District Court for the Southern District of New York (SDNY)
keyFacts: The FBI formally objected to the release of financial information (SARs) related to Jeffrey Epstein due to Ghislaine Maxwell's pending appeal.
FinCEN was pressured to release Epstein-related SARs due to civil lawsuits against JP Morgan Chase and Deutsche Bank, with a judge threatening to order disclosure.
A list of names and entities, including 'Nautilus Inc', 'Sothebys', and 'Robert Trivers', was provided to the FBI for deconfliction review.
The emails reveal internal FBI and USAO coordination to withhold information from civil litigation while Maxwell's criminal appeal is ongoing.
The document highlights the intersection of criminal appeals (Maxwell) and civil litigation (bank lawsuits) in the post-conviction phase of the Epstein case.
